intro: Tecoma filicifolia, commonly known as the fern-leaved trumpet tree, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its feathery, fern-like leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant is a member of the Bignoniaceae family, which includes other ornamental and economically important species. Tecoma filicifolia typically grows as a small to medium-sized tree or shrub, often reaching heights of up to 10 meters. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for ornamental landscaping in warm climates.
